title: Lower-Income Americans Are Missing Car Payments
summary: Inflation and a tough job market are making it harder for some people to pay back the car loans they signed in better times.

title: Wealthy Americans Are Spending. People With Less Are Struggling.
summary: Data show a resilient economy. But that largely reflects spending by the rich, while others pull back amid high prices and a weakening labor market.

title: Lawmaker Demands Hearing on U.S. Strikes on Boats in Caribbean
summary: Representative Adam Smith said the Trump administration had failed to provide a legal rationale for killing rather than arresting drug trafficking suspects.

title: To Fight ICE, Portland’s Leaders Turn to What They Know Best: Zoning
summary: Portland, Ore., is well known for its dense laws on land use. Now, under pressure from its liberal residents, the city is using those restrictions against immigrant detention.

title: Judge Demands Answers on Trump Immigration Crackdown in Chicago
summary: A federal judge has ordered operational leaders of the crackdown to appear before her on Monday to be questioned about their tactics and their use of tear gas.

title: Louvre Robbery May Have Been More About Stones Than Art, Experts Say
summary: Sunday’s robbery at the Paris museum could be the latest example of thieves targeting museums for jewels and precious metals to break down and sell on.

title: Louvre Museum Remains Closed After Jewelry Robbery: What to Know
summary: A stunning heist has raised uncomfortable questions about security at the Paris museum.

title: Other Brazen Art Heists Like the Louvre Jewelry Theft
summary: The robbery at the Paris museum on Sunday is only the latest in a long line of breaches.

title: Colin Jost, Pete Davidson and the Staten Island Ferry Fiasco
summary: Nearly four years after they bought an out-of-service ferryboat for $280,100, their plans for a floating event space may be running aground.

title: This Weekend’s Violence in Gaza Shows How Fragile the Cease-Fire Really Is
summary: A round of violence on Sunday was short-lived, but analysts expect more tensions between Israel and Palestinian militants that will put the truce under strain.

title: Where Does the Israel-Hamas Cease-Fire Stand?
summary: Unresolved issues and flare-ups of violence threaten to destabilize the fragile agreement.

title: Amazon’s AWS Disruption Creates Outages for Hundreds of Websites for Hours
summary: Amazon Web Services, a major provider of cloud services, cited a problem at its data center in Northern Virginia. The outage highlighted the fragility of global internet infrastructure.

title: Supreme Court Will Weigh Gun Restrictions for Drug Users
summary: The Second Amendment case tests a federal law used to convict Hunter Biden that bars drug users and addicts from possessing guns.

title: Canada Moves to Discourage Arctic Rivals as the Fabled Northwest Passage Opens Up
summary: The Inuit of the far north helped solve the mystery of a doomed 19th-century expedition. Now Canada needs them to strengthen its claim to this newly contested region.

title: A Norwegian Who Shared Underwear With the Inuit and Found the Northwest Passage
summary: Unlike the leader of the doomed Franklin expedition, Roald Amundsen delighted in getting to know and learning from the Inuit.

title: In China, a Forbidden Question Looms: Who Leads After Xi?
summary: Xi Jinping seems to believe that only his continued rule can secure China’s rise. But as he ages, choosing a successor will become riskier and more difficult.

title: AI Data Centers Create Fury From Mexico to Ireland
summary: As tech companies build data centers worldwide to advance artificial intelligence, vulnerable communities have been hit by blackouts and water shortages.

title: How Chile Embodies A.I.’s No-Win Politics
summary: Political debates have flared across Chile over artificial intelligence. Should the nation pour billions into A.I. and risk public backlash, or risk being left behind?

title: Peanut Allergies Have Plummeted in Children, Study Shows
summary: Doctors have long recommended that infants avoid peanuts. But in 2017, experts officially reversed that guidance, and food allergies decreased sharply.

title: For the Ghosts in a Berkshires Mansion, the Gilded Age Never Ended
summary: Ventfort Hall, an 1893 mansion built for J.P. Morgan’s sister, was in disrepair. The living and the dead teamed up to save it.

title: Fallen Confederate Statues Take Center Stage in a Bold New Show
summary: “Monuments,” a group exhibition in Los Angeles, led by Kara Walker, places contemporary art face to face with statuary removed in the last decade.

title: America Still Has a Political Center, and It’s the Key to Winning
summary: The antidote to our polarized politics is a creative, re-energized political center.

title: Senator Ruben Gallego Has Three Words for Democrats
summary: Lessons from a Democrat who won in a Republican state.

title: How Ultraprocessed Food Took Over America
summary: These products are among the greatest health threats of our time.

title: Prison Guard Convicted in Fatal Beating Caught on Video, With 2 Acquitted
summary: Footage of a group of guards punching, choking and stomping Robert L. Brooks ignited an outcry. Six guards pleaded guilty to charges, but for two, the gamble of a trial paid off.

title: Disney+ Cancellations Jump After Kimmel Suspension
summary: Roughly three million Americans canceled the streaming service in the month that it temporarily suspended Jimmy Kimmel’s show. About 4.1 million people canceled Disney-owned Hulu.

title: What to Know About Diwali, the Hindu Festival of Lights
summary: The biggest public holiday in India, Diwali features prayers for prosperity and good fortune — and lots of sweets.

title: Vision Restored Using Prosthetic Retinal Implant
summary: The device could help a million people with a severe form of macular degeneration to be able to see enough to read.
